attires.name: Hanfu
attires.description: The traditional style of clothing worn by the Han Chinese. There are several types of hanfu, such as the ruqun, the aoku, the daopao, and the shenyi.

attires.name: Qipao (Cheongsam)
attires.description: A stylish, often tight-fitting, one-piece Chinese dress for women. It was created in the 1920s in Shanghai and was made fashionable by socialites and upper-class women.

attires.name: Tangzhuang (Tang Suit)
attires.description: A type of Chinese jacket with a mandarin collar and frog buttons. It is a modern take on traditional Chinese clothing.
